cards.name: Ancestral Healing
cards.text: Restore a minion\nto full Health and\ngive it Taunt.
cards.flavor: I personally prefer some non-ancestral right-the-heck-now healing, but maybe that is just me.

cards.name: Backstab
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to an undamaged minion.
cards.flavor: It's funny how often yelling "Look over there!" gets your opponent to turn around.

cards.name: Innervate
cards.text: Gain 1 Mana Crystal this turn only.
cards.flavor: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling "Innervate me!!" at them.

cards.name: Moonfire
cards.text: Deal $1 damage.
cards.flavor: "Cast Moonfire, and never stop." - How to Be a Druid, Chapter 5, Section 3

cards.name: Power Word: Shield
cards.text: Give a minion +2_Health.
cards.flavor: Sure the extra protection is nice, but the shield really reduces visibility.

cards.name: Sacrificial Pact
cards.text: Destroy a Demon. Restore #5 Health to your hero.
cards.flavor: This is the reason that Demons never really become friends with Warlocks.

cards.name: Totemic Might
cards.text: Give your Totems +2_Health.
cards.flavor: Totem-stomping is no longer recommended.

cards.name: Arcane Missiles
cards.text: Deal $3 damage randomly split among all enemies.
cards.flavor: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.

cards.name: Arcane Shot
cards.text: Deal $2 damage.
cards.flavor: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves.  The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.

cards.name: Blessing of Might
cards.text: Give a minion +3_Attack.
cards.flavor: "As in, you MIGHT want to get out of my way." - Toad Mackle, recently buffed.

cards.name: Charge
cards.text: Give a friendly minion Charge. It can't attack heroes this turn.
cards.flavor: "Guys! Guys! Slow down!" - some kind of non-warrior minion

cards.name: Claw
cards.text: Give your hero +2_Attack this turn. Gain 2 Armor.
cards.flavor: The claw decides who will stay and who will go.

cards.name: Corruption
cards.text: Choose an enemy minion. At the start of your turn, destroy it.
cards.flavor: It starts with stealing a pen from work, and before you know it, BOOOM!  Corrupted!

cards.name: Deadly Poison
cards.text: Give your weapon +2_Attack.
cards.flavor: Rogues guard the secrets to poison-making carefully, lest magi start incorporating poison into their spells.  Poisonbolt? Rain of Poison?  Poison Elemental?  Nobody wants that.

cards.name: Elven Archer
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage.
cards.flavor: Don't bother asking her out on a date.  She'll shoot you down.

cards.name: Frost Shock
cards.text: Deal $1 damage to an enemy character and Freeze it.
cards.flavor: FROST SHOCK!

cards.name: Goldshire Footman
cards.text: Taunt
cards.flavor: If 1/2 minions are all that is defending Goldshire, you would think it would have been overrun years ago.

cards.name: Grimscale Oracle
cards.text: Your other Murlocs have +1 Attack.
cards.flavor: These are the brainy murlocs.  It turns out that doesn’t mean much.

cards.name: Hand of Protection
cards.text: Give a minion Divine Shield.
cards.flavor: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins don’t know what it should be called anymore.

cards.name: Holy Smite
cards.text: Deal $3 damage\nto a minion.
cards.flavor: It doesn't matter how pious you are.  Everyone needs a good smiting now and again.

cards.name: Humility
cards.text: Change a minion's Attack to 1.
cards.flavor: This card makes something really damp.  Oh wait.  That's "Humidity."

cards.name: Light's Justice
cards.flavor: Prince Malchezaar was a collector of rare weapons. He'd animate them and have them dance for him.

cards.name: Mind Vision
cards.text: Put a copy of a random card in your opponent's hand into your hand.
cards.flavor: I see what you did there.

cards.name: Mirror Image
cards.text: Summon two 0/2 minions with Taunt.
cards.flavor: Oh hey it's Mirror Image! !egamI rorriM s'ti yeh hO

cards.name: Mortal Coil
cards.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If that kills it, draw a card.
cards.flavor: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.

cards.name: Murloc Raider
cards.flavor: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!

cards.name: Psychic Conjurer
cards.text: Battlecry: Copy a card in your opponent’s deck and add it to your hand.
cards.flavor: "I see... a WISP? Why do you have a wisp?!"

cards.name: Radiance
cards.text: Restore #5 Health to your hero.
cards.flavor: Because you're worth it!

cards.name: Shadowhoof Slayer
cards.text: Battlecry: Give your hero +1_Attack this turn.
cards.flavor: Was a humble Elven Archer before Sargeras got to him.

cards.name: Sinister Strike
cards.text: Deal $3 damage to the_enemy hero.
cards.flavor: There's something about this strike that just feels off.  Sinister, even.

cards.name: Soulfire
cards.text: [x]Deal $4 damage.\nDiscard a random card.
cards.flavor: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.

cards.name: Stonetusk Boar
cards.text: Charge
cards.flavor: This card is boaring.

cards.name: Timber Wolf
cards.text: Your other Beasts have +1_Attack.
cards.flavor: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.

cards.name: Tracking
cards.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw one and discard the_others.
cards.flavor: For the person who just cannot decide what card to put into a deck!

cards.name: Voidwalker
cards.text: Taunt
cards.flavor: No relation to "The Voidsteppers", the popular Void-based dance troupe.

cards.name: Voodoo Doctor
cards.text: Battlecry: Restore #2_Health.
cards.flavor: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.

cards.name: Whirlwind
cards.text: Deal $1 damage to ALL_minions.
cards.flavor: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell "wheeeee" while whirlwinding.

cards.name: Acidic Swamp Ooze
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon.
cards.flavor: Oozes love Flamenco.  Don't ask.

cards.name: Arcane Explosion
cards.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions.
cards.flavor: This spell is much better than Arcane Implosion.

cards.name: Bloodfen Raptor
cards.flavor: "Kill 30 raptors." - Hemet Nesingwary

cards.name: Bluegill Warrior
cards.text: Charge
cards.flavor: He just wants a hug.   A sloppy... slimy... hug.

cards.name: Chaos Strike
cards.text: Give your hero +2_Attack this turn. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "What do we want?" "CHAOS!"\n "When do we want it?"\n "WHEN LEAST EXPECTED!"

cards.name: Cleave
cards.text: [x]Deal $2 damage to\ntwo random enemy\nminions.
cards.flavor: Hey you two…could you stand next to each other for a second…

cards.name: Execute
cards.text: Destroy a damaged enemy minion.
cards.flavor: It's okay, he deserved it.

cards.name: Felstalker
cards.text: Battlecry: Discard a random card.
cards.flavor: This puppy chews up cards instead of shoes.

cards.name: Frostbolt
cards.text: Deal $3 damage to a_character and Freeze it.
cards.flavor: It is customary to yell "Chill out!" or "Freeze!" or "Ice ice, baby!" when you play this card.

cards.name: Frostwolf Grunt
cards.text: Taunt
cards.flavor: Grunting is what his father did and his father before that.   It's more than just a job.

cards.name: Heroic Strike
cards.text: Give your hero +4_Attack this turn.
cards.flavor: Really, if you're a hero, this is every strike.

cards.name: Holy Light
cards.text: Restore #6 Health.
cards.flavor: If you are often bathed in Holy Light, you should consider wearing sunscreen.

cards.name: Hunter's Mark
cards.text: Change a minion's Health to 1.
cards.flavor: Never play 'Hide and Go Seek' with a Hunter.

cards.name: Kobold Geomancer
cards.text: Spell Damage +1
cards.flavor: In the old days, Kobolds were the finest candle merchants in the land. Then they got pushed too far...

cards.name: Mark of the Wild
cards.text: Give a minion Taunt and +2/+2.\n(+2 Attack/+2 Health)
cards.flavor: Not to be confused with Jim of the Wild.

cards.name: Murloc Tidehunter
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1_Murloc Scout.
cards.flavor: "Death will rise, from the tides!"

cards.name: Novice Engineer
cards.text: Battlecry: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.

cards.name: River Crocolisk
cards.flavor: Edward "Lefty" Smith tried to make luggage out of a river crocolisk once.

cards.name: Rockbiter Weapon
cards.text: Give a friendly character +3 Attack this turn.
cards.flavor: This would be real handy if your enemy is made of rock.

cards.name: Sap
cards.text: Return an enemy minion to your opponent's hand.
cards.flavor: Rogues love sappy movies.

cards.name: Shadow Word: Death
cards.text: Destroy a minion with 5_or more Attack.
cards.flavor: If you miss, it leaves a lightning-bolt-shaped scar on your target.

cards.name: Shadow Word: Pain
cards.text: Destroy a minion with 3_or less Attack.
cards.flavor: A step up from a spell cast by many beginning acolytes: "Shadow Word: Annoy".

cards.name: Shiv
cards.text: Deal $1 damage.\nDraw a card.
cards.flavor: Rogues are experts at SHIV-al-ry.

cards.name: Sightless Watcher
cards.text: Battlecry: Look at 3 cards in your deck. Choose one to put on top.
cards.flavor: What he lacks in sight, he makes up for in sleight-of-tentacle tricks.

cards.name: Windfury
cards.text: Give a minion Windfury.
cards.flavor: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.

cards.name: Aldrachi Warblades
cards.text: Lifesteal
cards.flavor: The ancient Aldrachi were the greatest warriors in the universe. Imagine their power if they'd put the handle at the END of the blade.

cards.name: Animal Companion
cards.text: Summon a random Beast Companion.
cards.flavor: You could summon Misha, Leokk, or Huffer!  Huffer is more trouble than he's worth.

cards.name: Arcane Intellect
cards.text: Draw 2 cards.
cards.flavor: Playing this card makes you SMARTER.  And let's face it: we could all stand to be a little smarter.

cards.name: Coordinated Strike
cards.text: Summon three 1/1_Illidari with Rush.
cards.flavor: Undisputed champions of "Dancing with the Satyrs."

cards.name: Dalaran Mage
cards.text: Spell Damage +1
cards.flavor: You don't see a lot of Dalaran warriors.

cards.name: Drain Life
cards.text: Deal $2 damage. Restore #2 Health to your hero.
cards.flavor: "I've just sucked one year of your life away."

cards.name: Fan of Knives
cards.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions. Draw_a card.
cards.flavor: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.

cards.name: Fiery War Axe
cards.flavor: During times of tranquility and harmony, this weapon was called by its less popular name, Chilly Peace Axe.

cards.name: Flametongue Totem
cards.text: Adjacent minions have +2_Attack.
cards.flavor: Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems.  There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.

cards.name: Frost Nova
cards.text: Freeze all enemy minions.
cards.flavor: Hey man, that's cold.  Literally and metaphorically.

cards.name: Healing Touch
cards.text: Restore #8 Health.
cards.flavor: 8 Health, no waiting.

cards.name: Ironforge Rifleman
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage.
cards.flavor: "Ready! Aim! Drink!"

cards.name: Ironfur Grizzly
cards.text: Taunt
cards.flavor: "Bear Carcass 1/10"

cards.name: Kill Command
cards.text: Deal $3 damage. If you control a Beast, deal\n$5 damage instead.
cards.flavor: "Kill!", he commanded.

cards.name: Magma Rager
cards.flavor: He likes to think he is powerful, but pretty much anyone can solo Molten Core now.

cards.name: Raid Leader
cards.text: Your other minions have +1 Attack.
cards.flavor: "That's a 50 DKP minus!"

cards.name: Razorfen Hunter
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1_Boar.
cards.flavor: Someone did mess with Tuskerr once.  ONCE.

cards.name: Satyr Overseer
cards.text: After your hero attacks, summon a 2/2 Satyr.
cards.flavor: What he lacks in communication skills, he makes up for with highly responsive staffing allocations.

cards.name: Savage Roar
cards.text: Give your characters +2_Attack this turn.
cards.flavor: What do they roar? Nobody can quite tell, but it sounds like "Elephant Macho Breeze".  It's probably not that, though.

cards.name: Shadow Bolt
cards.text: Deal $4 damage\nto a minion.
cards.flavor: It’s a Bolt.   It's made out of Shadow.   What more do you need to know!

cards.name: Shattered Sun Cleric
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +1/+1.
cards.flavor: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!

cards.name: Shield Block
cards.text: Gain 5 Armor.\nDraw a card.
cards.flavor: Shields were invented because Face Block is USELESS.

cards.name: Silverback Patriarch
cards.text: Taunt
cards.flavor: He likes to act like he's in charge, but the silverback matriarch actually runs things.

cards.name: Soul Cleave
cards.text: Lifesteal\nDeal $2 damage to two random enemy minions.
cards.flavor: The way to a demon's soul is through its stomach.

cards.name: Warsong Commander
cards.text: Your Charge minions have +1 Attack.
cards.flavor: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text: Gain an empty Mana Crystal.
cards.flavor: Grow your own mana crystals with this Mana Crystal Growth Kit, only 39.99!

cards.name: Wolfrider
cards.text: Charge
cards.flavor: Orcish raiders ride wolves because they are well adapted to harsh environments, and because they are soft and cuddly.

cards.name: Blessing of Kings
cards.text: Give a minion +4/+4. (+4 Attack/+4 Health)
cards.flavor: Given the number of kings who have been assassinated, are you sure you want their blessing?

cards.name: Chillwind Yeti
cards.flavor: He always dreamed of coming down from the mountains and opening a noodle shop, but he never got the nerve.

cards.name: Consecration
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to all_enemies.
cards.flavor: Consecrated ground glows with Holy energy.  But it smells a little, too.

cards.name: Dragonling Mechanic
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 2/1 Mechanical Dragonling.
cards.flavor: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text: Deal $6 damage.
cards.flavor: This spell is useful for burning things.  If you're looking for spells that toast things, or just warm them a little, you're in the wrong place.

cards.name: Gnomish Inventor
cards.text: Battlecry: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: She's never quite sure what she's making, she just knows it's AWESOME!

cards.name: Hammer of Wrath
cards.text: Deal $3 damage.\nDraw a card.
cards.flavor: A good paladin has many tools.  Hammer of Wrath, Pliers of Vengeance, Hacksaw of Justice, etc.

cards.name: Hellfire
cards.text: Deal $3 damage to ALL_characters.
cards.flavor: It's spells like these that make it hard for Warlocks to get decent help.

cards.name: Hex
cards.text: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.
cards.flavor: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?

cards.name: Holy Nova
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemy minions. Restore #2 Health to all friendly characters.
cards.flavor: If the Holy Light forsakes you, good luck casting this spell.  Also, you're probably a jerk.

cards.name: Houndmaster
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast +2/+2 and Taunt.
cards.flavor: "Who let the dogs out?" he asks.  It's rhetorical.

cards.name: Kor'kron Elite
cards.text: Charge
cards.flavor: The Kor'kron are the elite forces of Garrosh Hellscream. Let's just say you don't want to run into these guys while wearing a blue tabard.

cards.name: Multi-Shot
cards.text: Deal $3 damage to two random enemy minions.
cards.flavor: You see, it's all about throughput.

cards.name: Oasis Snapjaw
cards.flavor: His dreams of flying and breathing fire like his idol will never be realized.

cards.name: Ogre Magi
cards.text: Spell Damage +1
cards.flavor: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.

cards.name: Plaguebringer
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Poisonous.
cards.flavor: One sip and you've got the grippe.

cards.name: Polymorph
cards.text: Transform a minion\ninto a 1/1 Sheep.
cards.flavor: There was going to be a pun in this flavor text, but it just came out baa-d.

cards.name: Power Infusion
cards.text: Give a minion +2/+6.
cards.flavor: It infuses, it enthuses, it amuses!

cards.name: Sen'jin Shieldmasta
cards.text: Taunt
cards.flavor: Sen'jin Village is nice, if you like trolls and dust.

cards.name: Stormwind Knight
cards.text: Charge
cards.flavor: They're still embarrassed about "The Deathwing Incident".

cards.name: Swipe
cards.text: Deal $4 damage to an enemy and $1 damage to all other enemies.
cards.flavor: When a bear rears back and extends his arms, he's about to Swipe!  ... or hug.

cards.name: Truesilver Champion
cards.text: Whenever your hero attacks, restore #2_Health to it.
cards.flavor: It Slices, it Dices. You can cut a tin can with it. (But you wouldn't want to.)

cards.name: Water Elemental
cards.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
cards.flavor: Don't summon a water elemental at a party.  It'll dampen the mood.

cards.name: Windspeaker
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Windfury.
cards.flavor: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

cards.name: Arcanite Reaper
cards.flavor: No… actually you should fear the Reaper.

cards.name: Assassin's Blade
cards.flavor: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin.   Certificate of authenticity included.

cards.name: Assassinate
cards.text: Destroy an enemy minion.
cards.flavor: If you don't want to be assassinated, move to the Barrens and change your name. Good luck!

cards.name: Bloodlust
cards.text: Give your minions +3_Attack this turn.
cards.flavor: blaarghghLLGHRHARAAHAHHH!!

cards.name: Booty Bay Bodyguard
cards.text: Taunt
cards.flavor: You can hire him... until someone offers him enough gold to turn on you.

cards.name: Chaos Nova
cards.text: Deal $4 damage to all_minions.
cards.flavor: Illin' Illidan laying down the damage, flinging out the chaos as far as he can manage.

cards.name: Darkscale Healer
cards.text: Battlecry: Restore #2 Health to all friendly characters.
cards.flavor: Healing is just something she does in her free time.  It's more of a hobby really.

cards.name: Frostwolf Warlord
cards.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each other friendly minion on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley.  Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.

cards.name: Glaivebound Adept
cards.text: Battlecry: If your hero attacked this turn,\ndeal 4 damage.
cards.flavor: "Initiate, this is your glaive. Think of it as an extension of yourself... Did you just throw it?!"

cards.name: Gurubashi Berserker
cards.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3_Attack.
cards.flavor: No Pain, No Gain.

cards.name: Nightblade
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to the enemy hero.
cards.flavor: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.

cards.name: Starving Buzzard
cards.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.
cards.flavor: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.

cards.name: Stormpike Commando
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage.
cards.flavor: The Stormpike Commandos are demolition experts.  They also bake a mean cupcake.

cards.name: Tundra Rhino
cards.text: Your Beasts have Charge.
cards.flavor: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos.  Or am I mistaken?

cards.name: Archmage
cards.text: Spell Damage +1
cards.flavor: You earn the title of Archmage when you can destroy anyone who calls you on it.

cards.name: Boulderfist Ogre
cards.flavor: "ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST"

cards.name: Dread Infernal
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to ALL other characters.
cards.flavor: "INFERNOOOOOOOOOO!" - Jaraxxus, Eredar Lord of the Burning Legion

cards.name: Fire Elemental
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage.
cards.flavor: He can never take a bath. Ewww.

cards.name: Lord of the Arena
cards.text: Taunt
cards.flavor: He used to be a 2100+ rated arena player, but that was years ago and nobody can get him to shut up about it.

cards.name: Reckless Rocketeer
cards.text: Charge
cards.flavor: One Insane Rocketeer.   One Rocket full of Explosives.   Infinite Fun.

cards.name: Starfire
cards.text: Deal $5 damage.\nDraw a card.
cards.flavor: Balance is important to druids.  This card is perfectly balanced.

cards.name: Core Hound
cards.flavor: You don’t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.

cards.name: Flamestrike
cards.text: Deal $4 damage to all enemy minions.
cards.flavor: When the ground is on fire, you should not stop, drop, and roll.

cards.name: Guardian of Kings
cards.text: Battlecry: Restore #6 Health to your hero.
cards.flavor: Holy beings from the beyond are so cliché!

cards.name: Sprint
cards.text: Draw 4 cards.
cards.flavor: Rogues are not good joggers.

cards.name: Stormwind Champion
cards.text: Your other minions have +1/+1.
cards.flavor: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.

cards.name: War Golem
cards.flavor: Golems are not afraid, but for some reason they still run when you cast Fear on them.  Instinct, maybe?  A desire to blend in?

cards.name: Inner Demon
cards.text: Give your hero +8_Attack this turn.
cards.flavor: Critical component of any tragic backstory.

cards.name: Ironbark Protector
cards.text: Taunt
cards.flavor: I dare you to attack Darnassus.

cards.name: Mind Control
cards.text: Take control of an enemy minion.
cards.flavor: Nominated as "Spell Most Likely to Make Your Opponent Punch the Wall."

cards.name: Circle of Healing
cards.text: Restore #4 Health to ALL_minions.
cards.flavor: It isn't really a circle.

cards.name: Inner Rage
cards.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion and give it +2_Attack.
cards.flavor: They're only smiling on the outside.

cards.name: Preparation
cards.text: The next spell you cast this turn costs (2) less.
cards.flavor: "Be Prepared" - Rogue Motto

cards.name: Shadowstep
cards.text: Return a friendly minion to your hand. It_costs (2) less.
cards.flavor: Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance.  Crowds love it.

cards.name: Silence
cards.text: Silence a minion.
cards.flavor: Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.

cards.name: Wisp
cards.flavor: If you hit an Eredar Lord with enough Wisps, it will explode.   But why?

cards.name: Abusive Sergeant
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2_Attack this turn.
cards.flavor: ADD ME TO YOUR DECK, MAGGOT!

cards.name: Angry Chicken
cards.text: Has +5 Attack while damaged.
cards.flavor: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.

cards.name: Argent Squire
cards.text: Divine Shield
cards.flavor: "I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos." - The Argent Dawn Oath

cards.name: Bestial Wrath
cards.text: Give a friendly Beast +2 Attack and Immune this turn.
cards.flavor: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface.  Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.

cards.name: Blessing of Wisdom
cards.text: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.

cards.name: Blood Imp
cards.text: [x] Stealth. At the end of your \nturn, give another random\n friendly minion +1 Health.
cards.flavor: Imps are content to hide and viciously taunt everyone nearby.

cards.name: Bloodsail Corsair
cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Remove\n1 Durability from your\nopponent's weapon.
cards.flavor: Every pirate uses the same four digits to access Automated Gold Dispensers.  It's called the "Pirate's Code".

cards.name: Call of the Void
cards.text: Add a random Demon to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"Marco!"
"Polo!"
"Marco!"
"Who dares summon me?!"

cards.name: Dust Devil
cards.text: Windfury. Overload: (2)
cards.flavor: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

cards.name: Earth Shock
cards.text: Silence a minion, then deal $1 damage to it.
cards.flavor: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be "Azeroth Shock"?

cards.name: Eye for an Eye
cards.text: Secret: When your hero takes damage, deal_that much damage to the enemy hero.
cards.flavor: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.

cards.name: Flame Imp
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to your hero.
cards.flavor: Imps like being on fire.  They just do.

cards.name: Forked Lightning
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to 2_random enemy minions. Overload: (2)
cards.flavor: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.

cards.name: Hungry Crab
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy a Murloc and gain +2/+2.
cards.flavor: Murloc.  It's what's for dinner.

cards.name: Inner Fire
cards.text: Change a minion's Attack to be equal to its Health.
cards.flavor: Good idea: Buffing your minions.  Bad idea: Starting a conversation in the Barrens.

cards.name: Leper Gnome
cards.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy_hero.
cards.flavor: He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.

cards.name: Lightning Bolt
cards.text: Deal $3 damage. Overload: (1)
cards.flavor: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!

cards.name: Lightwarden
cards.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
cards.flavor: She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.

cards.name: Murloc Tidecaller
cards.text: Whenever you summon a Murloc, gain +1 Attack.
cards.flavor: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.

cards.name: Noble Sacrifice
cards.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target.
cards.flavor: We will always remember you, "Defender!"

cards.name: Pilfer
cards.text: Add a random card from another class to_your hand.
cards.flavor: The class is always greener on the other side of the board.

cards.name: Redemption
cards.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, return it to life with 1 Health.
cards.flavor: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time.  It’s a mystery!

cards.name: Repentance
cards.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, reduce its Health to 1.
cards.flavor: Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.

cards.name: Savagery
cards.text: Deal damage equal to your hero's Attack to a minion.
cards.flavor: It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.

cards.name: Scarlet Subjugator
cards.text: Battlecry: Give an enemy minion -2 Attack until your_next turn.
cards.flavor: At the Scarlet Monastery, he learned the sacred art of kicking people when they're up.

cards.name: Secretkeeper
cards.text: Whenever a Secret is played, gain +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Where is Mankrik’s wife? She’ll never tell.

cards.name: Shield Slam
cards.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.
cards.flavor: "What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?" - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9

cards.name: Shieldbearer
cards.text: Taunt
cards.flavor: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game??  This is no easy job.

cards.name: Southsea Deckhand
cards.text: Has Charge while you have a weapon equipped.
cards.flavor: Pirates are into this new fad called "Planking".

cards.name: Tome of Intellect
cards.text: Add a random Mage spell to your hand.
cards.flavor: Just a compilation of napkins of intellect.

cards.name: Upgrade!
cards.text: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.
cards.flavor: Easily worth 50 DKP.

cards.name: Worgen Infiltrator
cards.text: Stealth
cards.flavor: If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, "No! Bad boy!"

cards.name: Young Dragonhawk
cards.text: Windfury
cards.flavor: They were the inspiration for the championship Taurenball team: The Dragonhawks.

cards.name: Young Priestess
cards.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
cards.flavor: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.

cards.name: Amani Berserker
cards.text: Has +3 Attack while damaged.
cards.flavor: If an Amani berserker asks "Joo lookin' at me?!", the correct response is "Nah, mon".

cards.name: Ancestral Spirit
cards.text: Give a minion "Deathrattle: Resummon this minion."
cards.flavor: It was just a flesh wound.

cards.name: Ancient Watcher
cards.text: Can't attack.
cards.flavor: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?

cards.name: Argent Protector
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Divine Shield.
cards.flavor: "I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs.  I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to."

cards.name: Armorsmith
cards.text: Whenever a friendly minion_takes damage, gain 1 Armor.
cards.flavor: She accepts guild funds for repairs!

cards.name: Battle Rage
cards.text: Draw a card for each damaged friendly character.
cards.flavor: "You won't like me when I'm angry."

cards.name: Betrayal
cards.text: Force an enemy minion to deal its damage to the minions next to it.
cards.flavor: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.

cards.name: Bloodmage Thalnos
cards.text: Spell Damage +1\nDeathrattle: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!

cards.name: Bloodsail Raider
cards.text: Battlecry: Gain Attack equal to the Attack\nof your weapon.
cards.flavor: "I only plunder on days that end in 'y'."

cards.name: Cold Blood
cards.text: Give a minion +2 Attack. Combo: +4 Attack instead.
cards.flavor: "I'm cold blooded, check it and see!"

cards.name: Commanding Shout
cards.text: Your minions can't be reduced below 1 Health this turn. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Shout! Shout! Let it all out!" - Advice to warriors-in-training

cards.name: Crazed Alchemist
cards.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.
cards.flavor: "You'll love my new recipe!" he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.

cards.name: Cruel Taskmaster
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2_Attack.
cards.flavor: "I'm going to need you to come in on Sunday." - Cruel Taskmaster

cards.name: Defias Ringleader
cards.text: Combo: Summon a 2/1 Defias Bandit.
cards.flavor: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.

cards.name: Demonfire
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it’s a friendly Demon, give it +2/+2 instead.
cards.flavor: Demonfire is like regular fire except for IT NEVER STOPS BURNING HELLLPPP

cards.name: Dire Wolf Alpha
cards.text: Adjacent minions have +1_Attack.
cards.flavor: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.

cards.name: Doomsayer
cards.text: At the start of your turn, destroy ALL minions.
cards.flavor: He's almost been right so many times. He was sure it was coming during the Cataclysm.

cards.name: Eviscerate
cards.text: Deal $2 damage. Combo: Deal $4 damage instead.
cards.flavor: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent. You might tweak your elbow! That really hurts!

cards.name: Explosive Trap
cards.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, deal $2 damage to all enemies.
cards.flavor: It traps your food AND cooks it for you!

cards.name: Faerie Dragon
cards.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
cards.flavor: Adorable.  Immune to Magic.  Doesn't pee on the rug.  The perfect pet!

cards.name: Flare
cards.text: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!

cards.name: Freezing Trap
cards.text: Secret: When an enemy minion attacks, return it to its owner's hand. It costs (2) more.
cards.flavor: "Dang, that's cold." - appropriate response to Freezing Trap, or a mean joke.

cards.name: Icicle
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it's Frozen, draw a card.
cards.flavor: This may appear weak at frost glance, but it's actually a very ice spell.

cards.name: Knife Juggler
cards.text: [x]After you summon a\nminion, deal 1 damage\nto a random enemy.
cards.flavor: Ambitious Knife Jugglers sometimes graduate to Bomb Jugglers.    They never last long enough to make it onto a card though.

cards.name: Kul Tiran Chaplain
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +2 Health.
cards.flavor: The maritime Kul Tiran clergy are unique among priests for using holy saltwater.

cards.name: Lightwell
cards.text: At the start of your turn, restore #3 Health to a damaged friendly character.
cards.flavor: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.

cards.name: Loot Hoarder
cards.text: Deathrattle: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Always roll need.

cards.name: Lorewalker Cho
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player’s hand.
cards.flavor: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.

cards.name: Mad Bomber
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters.
cards.flavor: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.

cards.name: Mana Addict
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn.
cards.flavor: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.

cards.name: Mana Wraith
cards.text: ALL minions cost (1) more.
cards.flavor: They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. "Mmmmmm," they say.

cards.name: Mana Wyrm
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +1 Attack.
cards.flavor: These wyrms feed on arcane energies, and while they are generally considered a nuisance rather than a real threat, you really shouldn't leave them alone with a bucket of mana.

cards.name: Master Swordsmith
cards.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Attack.
cards.flavor: He's currently trying to craft a "flail-axe", but all the other swordsmiths say it can't be done.

cards.name: Millhouse Manastorm
cards.text: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (0) next turn.
cards.flavor: "I'm gonna light you up, sweetcheeks!"

cards.name: Misdirection
cards.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks your hero, instead it attacks another random character.
cards.flavor: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.

cards.name: Nat Pagle
cards.text: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
cards.flavor: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman!  He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).

cards.name: Patient Assassin
cards.text: Stealth\n Poisonous
cards.flavor: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.

cards.name: Pint-Sized Summoner
cards.text: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.
cards.flavor: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.

cards.name: Power of the Wild
cards.text: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1; or Summon a 3/2 Panther.
cards.flavor: Never look a panther in the eye.  Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'?  Well, it's one of those.

cards.name: Rampage
cards.text: Give a damaged minion +3/+3.
cards.flavor: Minion get ANGRY.   Minion SMASH!

cards.name: Scavenging Hyena
cards.text: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1.
cards.flavor: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything.  Even Brussels sprouts.

cards.name: Slam
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it survives, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Dun da dun, dun da dun": if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.

cards.name: Snake Trap
cards.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.
cards.flavor: Why did it have to be snakes?

cards.name: Snipe
cards.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, deal $4 damage to it.
cards.flavor: A great sniper hits the spot.  Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.

cards.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice
cards.text: Your spells cost (1) less.
cards.flavor: Apprentices are great for bossing around.  "Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee!  Make that a mana coffee!"

cards.name: Stormforged Axe
cards.text: Overload: (1)
cards.flavor: Yo, that's a nice axe.

cards.name: Sunfury Protector
cards.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Taunt.
cards.flavor: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.

cards.name: Thoughtsteal
cards.text: Copy 2 cards in your opponent's deck and add them to your hand.
cards.flavor: "What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc?  Nothing!" - Tauren joke

cards.name: Wild Pyromancer
cards.text: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions.
cards.flavor: BOOM BABY BOOM!  BAD IS GOOD!  DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

cards.name: Wrath
cards.text: Choose One -\nDeal $3 damage to a minion; or $1 damage\nand draw a card.
cards.flavor: The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.

cards.name: Youthful Brewmaster
cards.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
cards.flavor: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews.   Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!

cards.name: Alarm-o-Bot
cards.text: [x]At the start of your turn,\nswap this minion with a\n   random one in your hand.
cards.flavor: WARNING.  WARNING.  WARNING.

cards.name: Aldor Peacekeeper
cards.text: Battlecry: Change an_enemy minion's Attack to 1.
cards.flavor: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.

cards.name: Arcane Golem
cards.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
cards.flavor: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.

cards.name: Blood Knight
cards.text: Battlecry: All minions lose Divine Shield. Gain +3/+3 for each Shield lost.
cards.flavor: The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.

cards.name: Brightwing
cards.text: Battlecry: Add a random Legendary minion to your_hand.
cards.flavor: Little faerie dragons are made of sugar and spice and maniacal vice.

cards.name: Coldlight Seer
cards.text: Battlecry: Give your other Murlocs +2 Health.
cards.flavor: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths.  So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it.
cards.flavor: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't?  The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.

cards.name: Deadly Shot
cards.text: Destroy a random enemy minion.
cards.flavor: Our ballista operator is effective, but not picky.

cards.name: Demolisher
cards.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
cards.flavor: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone.  It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.

cards.name: Eaglehorn Bow
cards.text: [x]Whenever a friendly\nSecret is revealed,\ngain +1 Durability.
cards.flavor: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.

cards.name: Earthen Ring Farseer
cards.text: Battlecry: Restore #3_Health.
cards.flavor: He can see really far, and he doesn't use a telescope like those filthy pirates.

cards.name: Edwin VanCleef
cards.text: Combo: Gain +2/+2 for each other card you've played this turn.
cards.flavor: He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.

cards.name: Emperor Cobra
cards.text: Poisonous
cards.flavor: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray.  And plate armor.

cards.name: Far Sight
cards.text: Draw a card. That card costs (3) less.
cards.flavor: Drek'thar can't see, but he can see. You know what I mean? It's ok if you don't.

cards.name: Felguard
cards.text: Taunt\nBattlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.
cards.flavor: Yes, he'll fight for you.  BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

cards.name: Feral Spirit
cards.text: Summon two 2/3 Spirit Wolves with Taunt. Overload: (2)
cards.flavor: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.

cards.name: Flesheating Ghoul
cards.text: Whenever a minion dies, gain +1 Attack.
cards.flavor: 'Flesheating' is an unfair name.  It's just that there's not really much else for him to eat.

cards.name: Frothing Berserker
cards.text: Whenever a minion takes damage, gain +1 Attack.
cards.flavor: He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.

cards.name: Harvest Golem
cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 2/1 Damaged Golem.
cards.flavor: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."

cards.name: Headcrack
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn.
cards.flavor: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.

cards.name: Ice Barrier
cards.text: Secret: When your\nhero is attacked,\ngain 8 Armor.
cards.flavor: This is Rank 1.  Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.

cards.name: Imp Master
cards.text: [x]At the end of your turn, deal\n1 damage to this minion\n and summon a 1/1 Imp.
cards.flavor: She would enjoy the job a lot more if she just could get the imps to QUIT BITING HER.

cards.name: Injured Blademaster
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to HIMSELF.
cards.flavor: He claims it is an old war wound, but we think he just cut himself shaving.

cards.name: Ironbeak Owl
cards.text: Battlecry: Silence a_minion.
cards.flavor: Their wings are silent but their screech is... whatever the opposite of silent is.

cards.name: Jungle Panther
cards.text: Stealth
cards.flavor: Stranglethorn is a beautiful place to visit, but you wouldn't want to live there.

cards.name: King Mukla
cards.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent 2 Bananas.
cards.flavor: King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.

cards.name: Kirin Tor Mage
cards.text: [x]Battlecry: The next Secret\nyou play this turn costs (0).
cards.flavor: The Kirin Tor reside in the floating city of Dalaran.  How do you make a Dalaran float?  Two scoops of ice cream, one scoop of Dalaran.

cards.name: Lava Burst
cards.text: Deal $5 damage. Overload: (2)
cards.flavor: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!

cards.name: Lightning Storm
cards.text: Deal $2-$3 damage to all_enemy minions. Overload: (2)
cards.flavor: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.

cards.name: Mana Tide Totem
cards.text: At the end of your turn, draw a card.
cards.flavor: It is said that some shaman can say "Floatin' totem" 10 times, fast.

cards.name: Mark of Nature
cards.text: Choose One - Give a minion +4 Attack; or +4 Health and Taunt.
cards.flavor: Druids call it the "Mark of Nature."  Everyone else calls it "needing a bath."

cards.name: Mirror Entity
cards.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, summon a copy of it.
cards.flavor: "You go first." - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.

cards.name: Murloc Warleader
cards.text: Your other Murlocs have +2 Attack.
cards.flavor: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound?  Nope!  Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!

cards.name: Perdition's Blade
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage. Combo: Deal 2 instead.
cards.flavor: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

cards.name: Questing Adventurer
cards.text: Whenever you play a card, gain +1/+1.
cards.flavor: "Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?"

cards.name: Raging Worgen
cards.text: Has +1 Attack and Windfury while damaged.
cards.flavor: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.

cards.name: Scarlet Crusader
cards.text: Divine Shield
cards.flavor: Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.

cards.name: Sense Demons
cards.text: Draw 2 Demons\nfrom your deck.
cards.flavor: Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.

cards.name: Shadow Madness
cards.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.
cards.flavor: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.

cards.name: SI:7 Agent
cards.text: Combo: Deal 2 damage.
cards.flavor: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities.  Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.

cards.name: Southsea Captain
cards.text: Your other Pirates have +1/+1.
cards.flavor: When he saves enough plunder, he's going to commission an enormous captain's hat.  He has hat envy.

cards.name: Spellbender
cards.text: Secret: When an enemy casts a spell on a minion, summon a 1/3 as the new target.
cards.flavor: While it's fun to intercept enemy lightning bolts, a spellbender much prefers to intercept opposing Marks of the Wild.  It just feels meaner.  And blood elves... well, they're a little mean.

cards.name: Sword of Justice
cards.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1_Durability.
cards.flavor: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!

cards.name: Tauren Warrior
cards.text: Taunt\nHas +3 Attack while damaged.
cards.flavor: Tauren Warrior: Champion of Mulgore, Slayer of Quilboar, Rider of Thunderbluff Elevators.

cards.name: Thrallmar Farseer
cards.text: Windfury
cards.flavor: He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.

cards.name: Tinkmaster Overspark
cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel.
cards.flavor: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.

cards.name: Unbound Elemental
cards.text: Whenever you play a card_with Overload, gain_+1/+1.
cards.flavor: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.

cards.name: Unleash the Hounds
cards.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.
cards.flavor: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.

cards.name: Vaporize
cards.text: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it.
cards.flavor: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card.  We may never know the truth.

cards.name: Void Terror
cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Destroy both\nadjacent minions and gain\n their Attack and Health.
cards.flavor: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

cards.name: Ancient Brewmaster
cards.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
cards.flavor: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak.  But apparently that's a compliment.

cards.name: Ancient Mage
cards.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent_minions Spell_Damage +1.
cards.flavor: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.

cards.name: Arathi Weaponsmith
cards.text: Battlecry: Equip a 2/2_weapon.
cards.flavor: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

cards.name: Bite
cards.text: Give your hero +4_Attack this turn. Gain 4 Armor.
cards.flavor: Chew your food!

cards.name: Blade Flurry
cards.text: Destroy your weapon and deal its damage to all enemy minions.
cards.flavor: "Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast.  It's a lot more complicated than that." - Shan, Rogue Trainer

cards.name: Cone of Cold
cards.text: Freeze a minion and the minions next to it, and deal $1 damage to them.
cards.flavor: Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.

cards.name: Cult Master
cards.text: After a friendly minion dies, draw a card.
cards.flavor: She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.

cards.name: Dark Iron Dwarf
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2_Attack this turn.
cards.flavor: Guardians of Dark Iron Ore.  Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.

cards.name: Defender of Argus
cards.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions +1/+1 and Taunt.
cards.flavor: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending.  But it does.

cards.name: Dread Corsair
cards.text: Taunt\nCosts (1) less per Attack of_your weapon.
cards.flavor: "Yarrrr" is a pirate word that means "Greetings, milord."

cards.name: Equality
cards.text: Change the Health of ALL minions to 1.
cards.flavor: We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.

cards.name: Ethereal Arcanist
cards.text: If you control a Secret at_the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.
cards.flavor: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

cards.name: Keeper of the Grove
cards.text: Choose One - Deal_2_damage; or Silence a minion.
cards.flavor: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

cards.name: Lightspawn
cards.text: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.
cards.flavor: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?

cards.name: Mass Dispel
cards.text: Silence all enemy minions. Draw a card.
cards.flavor: It dispels buffs, powers, hopes, and dreams.

cards.name: Master of Disguise
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Stealth until your next turn.
cards.flavor: She's actually a male tauren.  People don't call him "Master of Disguise" for nothing.

cards.name: Mindgames
cards.text: Put a copy of\na random minion from\nyour opponent's deck into the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.

cards.name: Mogu'shan Warden
cards.text: Taunt
cards.flavor: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King.   BOOOORRRINNG!

cards.name: Mortal Strike
cards.text: Deal $4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $6 instead.
cards.flavor: "If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike." - The Warrior Code, Line 6

cards.name: Pit Lord
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 5 damage to your hero.
cards.flavor: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

cards.name: Shadow Word: Ruin
cards.text: Destroy all minions with 5 or more Attack.
cards.flavor: Discovered by a worgen priest after a giant spilled a drink on her new white robes.

cards.name: Shadowflame
cards.text: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.
cards.flavor: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!

cards.name: SI:7 Infiltrator
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy Secret.
cards.flavor: What will she destroy? It’s a secret!

cards.name: Silvermoon Guardian
cards.text: Divine Shield
cards.flavor: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…

cards.name: Soul of the Forest
cards.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant."
cards.flavor: "Reforestation" is suddenly a terrifying word.

cards.name: Summoning Portal
cards.text: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).
cards.flavor: NOT LESS THAN 1!  Don't get any ideas!

cards.name: Twilight Drake
cards.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy.  And Tacos.

cards.name: Violet Teacher
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice.
cards.flavor: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig.  And then you get your name on the board.

cards.name: Abomination
cards.text: Taunt. Deathrattle: Deal 2\ndamage to ALL characters.
cards.flavor: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.

cards.name: Bane of Doom
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to_a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.
cards.flavor: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.

cards.name: Big Game Hunter
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with 7 or more Attack.
cards.flavor: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him.  Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.

cards.name: Blessed Champion
cards.text: Double a minion's Attack.
cards.flavor: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

cards.name: Brawl
cards.text: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly)
cards.flavor: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?

cards.name: Captain Greenskin
cards.text: Battlecry: Give your weapon +1/+1.
cards.flavor: He was this close to piloting a massive juggernaut into Stormwind Harbor. If it weren't for those pesky kids!

cards.name: Doomhammer
cards.text: Windfury, Overload: (2)
cards.flavor: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall.  His name is a total coincidence.

cards.name: Druid of the Claw
cards.text: [x]Choose One - Transform\ninto a 4/4 with Charge;\nor a 4/6 with Taunt.
cards.flavor: Cat or Bear?  Cat or Bear?!  I just cannot CHOOSE!

cards.name: Earth Elemental
cards.text: Taunt\nOverload: (3)
cards.flavor: Nothing beats rock.

cards.name: Explosive Shot
cards.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion and $2 damage to adjacent ones.
cards.flavor: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot.  Then duck.

cards.name: Faceless Manipulator
cards.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.
cards.flavor: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.

cards.name: Fen Creeper
cards.text: Taunt
cards.flavor: He used to be called Bog Beast, but it confused people because he wasn't an actual beast.   Boom, New Name!

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text: Summon three 2/2 Treants.
cards.flavor: "I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!" - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

cards.name: Harrison Jones
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.
cards.flavor: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”

cards.name: Holy Wrath
cards.text: Draw a card and deal_damage equal to_its Cost.
cards.flavor: C'mon Molten Giant!!

cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Give your minions Divine Shield.
cards.flavor: Shield yourself in righteousness! It feels like a warm fuzzy blanket.

cards.name: Silver Hand Knight
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 2/2_Squire.
cards.flavor: It's good to be a knight.   Less so to be one's squire.

cards.name: Spiteful Smith
cards.text: Your weapon has +2 Attack while this is damaged.
cards.flavor: She'll craft you a sword, but you'll need to bring her 5 Steel Ingots, 3 Motes of Earth, and the scalp of her last customer.

cards.name: Stampeding Kodo
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.
cards.flavor: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.

cards.name: Starfall
cards.text: Choose One -\nDeal $5 damage to a minion; or $2 damage to all enemy minions.
cards.flavor: Is the sky falling?  Yes.  Yes it is.

cards.name: Stranglethorn Tiger
cards.text: Stealth
cards.flavor: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!

cards.name: Temple Enforcer
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +3 Health.
cards.flavor: He also moonlights Thursday nights as a bouncer at the Pig and Whistle Tavern.

cards.name: Venture Co. Mercenary
cards.text: Your minions cost (3) more.
cards.flavor: No Job is too big.  No fee is too big.

cards.name: Argent Commander
cards.text: Charge\nDivine Shield
cards.flavor: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.

cards.name: Avenging Wrath
cards.text: Deal $8 damage randomly split among all enemies.
cards.flavor: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!

cards.name: Blizzard
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemy minions and Freeze them.
cards.flavor: This spell can be very Entertaining.

cards.name: Cabal Shadow Priest
cards.text: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.
cards.flavor: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....

cards.name: Cairne Bloodhoof
cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/5 Baine Bloodhoof.
cards.flavor: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck.  It's pretty insensitive.

cards.name: Frost Elemental
cards.text: Battlecry: Freeze a_character.
cards.flavor: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...

cards.name: Gadgetzan Auctioneer
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card.
cards.flavor: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.

cards.name: Hogger
cards.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with_Taunt.
cards.flavor: Hogger is super powerful. If you kill him, it's because he let you.

cards.name: Kidnapper
cards.text: Combo: Return a minion to_its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: He just wants people to see his vacation photos.

cards.name: Nourish
cards.text: Choose One - Gain 2_Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.
cards.flavor: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.

cards.name: Priestess of Elune
cards.text: Battlecry: Restore #4 Health to your hero.
cards.flavor: If she threatens to "moon" you, it's not what you think.

cards.name: Savannah Highmane
cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 2/2 Hyenas.
cards.flavor: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

cards.name: Siphon Soul
cards.text: Destroy a minion. Restore #3 Health to_your hero.
cards.flavor: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul.  You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.

cards.name: Sunwalker
cards.text: Taunt\nDivine Shield
cards.flavor: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun.  It's just a name.  Don’t worry!

cards.name: The Beast
cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Finkle Einhorn for your opponent.
cards.flavor: He lives in Blackrock Mountain.  He eats Gnomes.  That's pretty much it.

cards.name: The Black Knight
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy an enemy minion with Taunt.
cards.flavor: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament.   We can pretty much mark that a failure.

cards.name: Windfury Harpy
cards.text: Windfury
cards.flavor: Harpies are not pleasant sounding.  That's the nicest I can put it.

cards.name: Xavius
cards.text: After you play a card, summon a 2/1 Satyr.
cards.flavor: Xavius has grand nightmares of summoning Sargeras into this world, but a few Satyr will have to do for now.

cards.name: Ancient of Lore
cards.text: Choose One - Draw a card; or Restore #5 Health.
cards.flavor: Go ahead, carve your initials in him.

cards.name: Ancient of War
cards.text: Choose One -\n+5 Attack; or +5 Health and Taunt.
cards.flavor: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?"  You lose if you get crushed to death.

cards.name: Archmage Antonidas
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to_your hand.
cards.flavor: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor.  This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.

cards.name: Baron Geddon
cards.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.
cards.flavor: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.

cards.name: Barrens Stablehand
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a random Beast.
cards.flavor: It’s never Huffer.

cards.name: Gladiator's Longbow
cards.text: Your hero is Immune while attacking.
cards.flavor: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.

cards.name: Gorehowl
cards.text: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability.
cards.flavor: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe.  Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession.  Quite the mystery!

cards.name: High Inquisitor Whitemane
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon all friendly minions that died_this turn.
cards.flavor: No one told her that champions want to sleep in.

cards.name: Ravenholdt Assassin
cards.text: Stealth
cards.flavor: Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold.  He'll take care of the rest.

cards.name: Siegebreaker
cards.text: Taunt\nYour other Demons have +1 Attack.
cards.flavor: Has a side hustle as a siegebroker.

cards.name: Al'Akir the Windlord
cards.text: Charge, Divine Shield, Taunt, Windfury
cards.flavor: He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords.  And the other three don't let him forget it.

cards.name: Arcane Devourer
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2/+2.
cards.flavor: Likes her magic with a pinch of salt.

cards.name: Gift of the Wild
cards.text: Give your minions +2/+2 and Taunt.
cards.flavor: The gift that keeps on living.

cards.name: Grommash Hellscream
cards.text: Charge\nHas +6 Attack while damaged.
cards.flavor: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes!  Maybe not his best decision.

cards.name: Gruul
cards.text: At the end of each turn, gain +1/+1 .
cards.flavor: He's Gruul "the Dragonkiller".  He just wanted to cuddle them… he never meant to…

cards.name: Lay on Hands
cards.text: Restore #8 Health. Draw_3 cards.
cards.flavor: A grammatically awkward life saver.

cards.name: Natalie Seline
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion and gain its Health.
cards.flavor: She discovered Xal'atath, Blade of the Black Empire, a terrible weapon of shadow magic that could both swallow a soul and cut a mean julienne.

cards.name: Tirion Fordring
cards.text: Divine Shield, Taunt Deathrattle: Equip a 5/3_Ashbringer.
cards.flavor: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.

cards.name: Twisting Nether
cards.text: Destroy all minions.
cards.flavor: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.

cards.name: Alexstrasza
cards.text: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.
cards.flavor: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone.  Except Deathwing.  And Malygos.  And Nekros.

cards.name: Cenarius
cards.text: Choose One - Give your other minions +2/+2; or Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt.
cards.flavor: Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.

cards.name: King Krush
cards.text: Charge
cards.flavor: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.

cards.name: Lord Jaraxxus
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus.
cards.flavor: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"

cards.name: Malygos
cards.text: Spell Damage +5
cards.flavor: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic.  He gets so mad!

cards.name: Nozdormu
cards.text: Players only have 15 seconds to take their_turns.
cards.flavor: Time to write some flavor text.

cards.name: Onyxia
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.
cards.flavor: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor.   You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.

cards.name: Ysera
cards.text: At the end of your turn, add_a Dream Card to_your hand.
cards.flavor: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream.  Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?

cards.name: Deathwing
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your_hand.
cards.flavor: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated.  Daddy issues?

cards.name: Pyroblast
cards.text: Deal $10 damage.
cards.flavor: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

cards.name: Sea Giant
cards.text: Costs (1) less for each other minion on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: See?  Giant.

cards.name: Zap!
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. Overload: (1)
cards.flavor: The material components for this spell are wool socks and a rug.

cards.name: Blazing Invocation
cards.text: Discover a Battlecry minion.
cards.flavor: A lot of shaman have started vaping their invocations.

cards.name: Chameleos
cards.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a card your opponent is holding.
cards.flavor: He's everyone you want to be.

cards.name: Dark Possession
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a friendly character. Discover a Demon.
cards.flavor: Wanted on three counts of gnomish possession.

cards.name: Hidden Wisdom
cards.text: [x]Secret: After your opponent plays three cards in a turn, draw 2 cards.
cards.flavor: Find your own wisdom. Perhaps behind the couch.

cards.name: Swamp Dragon Egg
cards.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Dragon to your hand.
cards.flavor: Would you eat them in a ditch? Would you eat them with a witch?

cards.name: Swamp Leech
cards.text: Lifesteal
cards.flavor: A face only a druid could love.

cards.name: Town Crier
cards.text: Battlecry: Draw a Rush minion from your deck.
cards.flavor: When he was younger, he was the town crybaby.

cards.name: Witch's Apprentice
cards.text: Taunt\nBattlecry: Add a random Shaman spell to your hand.
cards.flavor: Is she a frog that became a witch, or a witch that became a frog?

cards.name: Witchwood Imp
cards.text: [x]Stealth\nDeathrattle: Give a random\n friendly minion +2 Health.
cards.flavor: This wood imp. Stop asking!

cards.name: Archmage Arugal
cards.text: Whenever you draw a minion, add a copy of it to_your hand.
cards.flavor: His worgen children call him Archmage AROO-OO-OO-OO-gal.

cards.name: Baleful Banker
cards.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Shuffle a copy into your deck.
cards.flavor: He's gotten big into crypt-o-currency.

cards.name: Book of Specters
cards.text: Draw 3 cards. Discard any spells drawn.
cards.flavor: Known throughout the land as the Spooky-nomicon.

cards.name: Cathedral Gargoyle
cards.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.
cards.flavor: Fly like an eagle, drop like a rock.

cards.name: Cheap Shot
cards.text: Echo\n Deal $2 damage to a_minion.
cards.flavor: 50% off. Every shot must go!

cards.name: Curse of Weakness
cards.text: Echo\nGive all enemy minions -2_Attack until your next_turn.
cards.flavor: Warlocks refer to this as a "balance change."

cards.name: Divine Hymn
cards.text: Restore #6 Health to all friendly characters.
cards.flavor: Taken up an octave, it's highly effective against stained glass golems.

cards.name: Earthen Might
cards.text:
[x]Give a minion +2/+2.
If it's an Elemental, add
a random Elemental
to your hand.
cards.flavor: Or it might not.

cards.name: Ghost Light Angler
cards.text: Echo
cards.flavor: BoOooOogrglgrlgrlooOoOoo!

cards.name: Hunting Mastiff
cards.text: Echo\nRush
cards.flavor: "Shh! You're going to start a howl!"

cards.name: Lost Spirit
cards.text: Deathrattle: Give your minions +1 Attack.
cards.flavor: She simply refuses to ask for directions.

cards.name: Pick Pocket
cards.text: Echo\nAdd a random card to your hand (from your opponent's class).
cards.flavor: He'll pick anyone's pocket, except a gnome's. He'd never stoop so low.

cards.name: Rat Trap
cards.text: [x]Secret: After your opponent plays three cards in a turn, summon a 6/6 Rat.
cards.flavor: MISSING: One giant rat. Please return to King Togwaggle.

cards.name: Rebuke
cards.text: Enemy spells cost (5) more next turn.
cards.flavor: When one buke just isn’t enough.

cards.name: Redband Wasp
cards.text: Rush\nHas +3 Attack while damaged.
cards.flavor: Also comes in other colors, but red's in fashion this season.

cards.name: Snap Freeze
cards.text: Freeze a minion.\nIf it's already Frozen, destroy it.
cards.flavor: Lick the ice block. I triple-double-dog-dare-you.

cards.name: Sound the Bells!
cards.text: Echo\nGive a minion +1/+2.
cards.flavor: Weirdly, the bells stop ringing after 5.

cards.name: Spellshifter
cards.text: [x]Spell Damage +1\nEach turn this is in your hand,\nswap its Attack and Health.
cards.flavor: He also goes by "worg-lock."

cards.name: Squashling
cards.text: [x]Echo\nBattlecry: Restore #2 Health.
cards.flavor: Everyone hail to the squashling song!

cards.name: Vicious Scalehide
cards.text: Lifesteal\nRush
cards.flavor: They make wonderful pets if you're not allergic to blood loss.

cards.name: Warpath
cards.text: Echo\nDeal $1 damage to all_minions.
cards.flavor: "Left, right, left, right, there's none of the enemy left… Right?"

cards.name: Witchwood Apple
cards.text: Add three 2/2 Treants to your hand.
cards.flavor: An apple a day keeps the worgen at bay.

cards.name: Woodcutter's Axe
cards.text: Deathrattle: Give +2/+1 to a random friendly Rush minion.
cards.flavor: It's a lumberjack's axe and that's ok.

cards.name: Blackwald Pixie
cards.text: Battlecry: Refresh your Hero Power.
cards.flavor: "Oh hi bark."

cards.name: Blink Fox
cards.text: Battlecry: Add a random card to your hand (from your opponent's class).
cards.flavor: It's like, SUPER bad at staring contests.

cards.name: Cinderstorm
cards.text: Deal $5 damage randomly split among all enemies.
cards.flavor: Forecast: "Cloudy with a chance of fireballs."

cards.name: Cutthroat Buccaneer
cards.text: Combo: Give your weapon +1 Attack.
cards.flavor: In life he worked as a sword swallower.

cards.name: Druid of the Scythe
cards.text: [x]Choose One - Transform\ninto a 4/2 with Rush;\nor a 2/4 with Taunt.
cards.flavor: She's a scythe for sore eyes.

cards.name: Duskbat
cards.text: Battlecry: If your hero took damage this turn, summon two 1/1 Bats.
cards.flavor: Happily married with two kids. It was love at first bite.

cards.name: Duskhaven Hunter
cards.text: [x]Stealth\nEach turn this is in your hand,\nswap its Attack and Health.
cards.flavor: After a short paws, she's back to herself again.

cards.name: Face Collector
cards.text: Echo\nBattlecry: Add a random Legendary minion to your hand.
cards.flavor: “I’ll trade you a Malfurion for an Anduin.”

cards.name: Ferocious Howl
cards.text: Draw a card.\nGain 1 Armor for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: Have you ever heard the wolf cry to the blue corn moon?

cards.name: Hench-Clan Thug
cards.text: After your hero attacks, give this minion +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Hard time making ends meet? Hate the League of Explorers? Get a job henching!

cards.name: Marsh Drake
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 2/1 Poisonous Drakeslayer for your opponent.
cards.flavor: She would have gotten away with it, if it weren't for that meddling Drakeslayer.

cards.name: Nightmare Amalgam
cards.text: [x]This is an Elemental, Mech,\nDemon, Murloc, Dragon,\nBeast, Pirate and Totem.
cards.flavor: Be all that you can be.

cards.name: Paragon of Light
cards.text: While this minion has 3 or more Attack, it has Taunt and Lifesteal.
cards.flavor: She’s all fun and games until someone rings that stupid bell.

cards.name: Phantom Militia
cards.text: Echo\nTaunt
cards.flavor: Recruited from the Gilnean opera house.

cards.name: Pumpkin Peasant
cards.text: [x]Lifesteal\nEach turn this is in your hand,\nswap its Attack and Health.
cards.flavor: Time to squash your opponent.

cards.name: Rabid Worgen
cards.text: Rush
cards.flavor: "I'm sorry, son.  We had to send Old Howler off…to a farm…to play…"

cards.name: Ratcatcher
cards.text: Rush\nBattlecry: Destroy a friendly minion and gain its Attack and Health.
cards.flavor: He's on the hunt for Togwaggle's missing rat.

cards.name: Ravencaller
cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Add two\nrandom 1-Cost minions\nto your hand.
cards.flavor: That Friends and Familiars Plan is really paying off!

cards.name: Tanglefur Mystic
cards.text: Battlecry: Add a random\n2-Cost minion to each player's hand.
cards.flavor: Doom!  Only doom for you!  But pay good tip, maybe less doom.

cards.name: Vivid Nightmare
cards.text: [x]Choose a friendly minion.\nSummon a copy of it with\n1 Health remaining.
cards.flavor: "I… I dreamed I accidentally crafted a golden Millhouse! It was so REAL!"

cards.name: Voodoo Doll
cards.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion. Deathrattle: Destroy the chosen minion.
cards.flavor: "Aww, I love it! It even kinda looks like me."

cards.name: Walnut Sprite
cards.text: Echo
cards.flavor: How do you make a walnut laugh? Crack it up!

cards.name: Witch's Cauldron
cards.text: After a friendly minion dies, add a random Shaman spell to your hand.
cards.flavor: Eye of murloc, ear of bat, foot of Fordring, fur of cat…

cards.name: Witching Hour
cards.text: Summon a random friendly Beast that died this game.
cards.flavor: The gates to the Gilnean pet cemetary MUST remain locked at all times.

cards.name: Arcane Keysmith
cards.text: Battlecry: Discover a Secret. Put it into the battlefield.
cards.flavor: She sells all manner of keys: from A flat to G sharp.

cards.name: Bellringer Sentry
cards.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Put a Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Who are you? Eh, none of my business."

cards.name: Blood Witch
cards.text: At the start of your turn, deal 1 damage to your_hero.
cards.flavor: Like a sloppy joe for vampires.

cards.name: Dire Frenzy
cards.text: Give a Beast +3/+3. Shuffle 3 copies into your deck with +3/+3.
cards.flavor: It's always Huffer. And Huffer. And Huffer. And Huffer.

cards.name: Felsoul Inquisitor
cards.text: Lifesteal\nTaunt
cards.flavor: Everyone expects an inquisition reference.

cards.name: Fiendish Circle
cards.text: [x]Summon four 1/1 Imps.
cards.flavor: Like a knitting circle, but less evil.

cards.name: Forest Guide
cards.text: At the end of your turn, both players draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Just sign this waiver, and we'll be on our way."

cards.name: Houndmaster Shaw
cards.text: Your other minions have\nRush.
cards.flavor: They’re good dogs, Tess.

cards.name: Lifedrinker
cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to\nthe enemy hero. Restore\n#3 Health to your hero.
cards.flavor: In a pinch, he'll also settle for Holy Water: Zero.

cards.name: Mad Hatter
cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Randomly toss\n3 hats to other minions.\nEach hat gives +1/+1.
cards.flavor: He's entirely bonkers. All the best goblins are.

cards.name: Militia Commander
cards.text: Rush\nBattlecry: Gain +3_Attack this turn.
cards.flavor: She only needs two commands: "Heel" and "Sic 'em!"

cards.name: Mistwraith
cards.text: Whenever you play an Echo_card, gain +1/+1.
cards.flavor: One little Mistwraith sitting in a tree. M-I-S-T-I-N-G.

cards.name: Night Prowler
cards.text: Battlecry: If this is the only minion on the battlefield, gain +3/+3.
cards.flavor: Listen to the mew-sic of the night.

cards.name: Sandbinder
cards.text: Battlecry: Draw an Elemental from your deck.
cards.flavor: The secret is glue.

cards.name: Scaleworm
cards.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Rush.
cards.flavor: A popular local alternative to bananas.

cards.name: Spectral Cutlass
cards.text: [x]Lifesteal Whenever you play a card from another class, gain +1 Durability.
cards.flavor: So sharp it can cut through a spectral tomato!

cards.name: Swift Messenger
cards.text: [x]Rush\nEach turn this is in your hand,\nswap its Attack and Health.
cards.flavor: Same turn delivery - guaranteed!

cards.name: The Glass Knight
cards.text: [x]Divine Shield\nWhenever you restore Health,\ngain Divine Shield.
cards.flavor: She seems scary, but she's got a glass jaw.

cards.name: Totem Cruncher
cards.text: Taunt\nBattlecry: Destroy your Totems. Gain +2/+2 for each destroyed.
cards.flavor: When regular totem hours won't cut it.

cards.name: Toxmonger
cards.text: [x]Whenever you play a 1-Cost\nminion, give it Poisonous.
cards.flavor: Not all spiders are born poisonous. That's where he comes in.

cards.name: Unpowered Steambot
cards.text: Taunt
cards.flavor: Overpowered Steambot got nerfed.

cards.name: Vex Crow
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a random\n2-Cost minion.
cards.flavor: As birds of ill omen, these crows often summon Doomsayers.

cards.name: WANTED!
cards.text: Deal $3 damage to a minion. If that kills it, add a Coin to your hand.
cards.flavor: Wanted: Dead or Undead.

cards.name: Wing Blast
cards.text: Deal $4 damage to a minion. If a minion died this turn, this costs (1).
cards.flavor: Emeriss uses Wing Blast.  It's super effective!

cards.name: Wispering Woods
cards.text: [x]Summon a 1/1 Wisp for\neach card in your hand.
cards.flavor: We didn't actually fire the guy who named Dark Wispers.

cards.name: Witchwood Piper
cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Draw the lowest\nCost minion from your deck.
cards.flavor: She rids villages of annoying pests, like rats and children.

cards.name: Bewitched Guardian
cards.text: [x]Taunt\nBattlecry: Gain +1 Health\n_for each card in your hand._
cards.flavor: Amwitched. Beingwitched. Beenwitched.

cards.name: Bonfire Elemental
cards.text: Battlecry: If you played an_Elemental last turn, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Next step: Marshmallow elementals.

cards.name: Carrion Drake
cards.text: Battlecry: If a minion died this turn, gain Poisonous.
cards.flavor: Fits easily into overhead luggage bins.

cards.name: Chief Inspector
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy all enemy Secrets.
cards.flavor: Empty your pockets, I know you’ve got a Wandering Monster in there!

cards.name: Clockwork Automaton
cards.text: Double the damage and_healing of your Hero_Power.
cards.flavor: Most mechs are pretty chill, but this one is all wound up.

cards.name: Curio Collector
cards.text: Whenever you draw a card, gain +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Experts worry that curios are a gateway to face-collecting.

cards.name: Darius Crowley
cards.text: [x]Rush\nAfter this attacks and kills\na minion, gain +2/+2.
cards.flavor: You either die a villain, or live long enough to see yourself become the hero.

cards.name: Deathweb Spider
cards.text: Battlecry: If your hero\ntook damage this turn, gain Lifesteal.
cards.flavor: The itsy bitsy spiders climbed up the village wall. Then came the witch and the spiders ate them all.

cards.name: Dollmaster Dorian
cards.text: Whenever you draw a minion, summon a 1/1 copy of it.
cards.flavor: The children were puzzled by the scratches covering the insides of their toy-boxes.

cards.name: Duskfallen Aviana
cards.text: On each player's turn, the first card played costs (0).
cards.flavor: Someone called her "Tweety". She didn't take it well.

cards.name: Festeroot Hulk
cards.text: After a friendly minion attacks, gain +1 Attack.
cards.flavor: Tree puns arboring.

cards.name: Ghostly Charger
cards.text: Divine Shield\nRush
cards.flavor: Maybe we should have called him Ghostly Rusher.

cards.name: Holy Water
cards.text: Deal $4 damage to a minion. If that kills it, add a copy of it to your_hand.
cards.flavor: For a healthier option, try Holy Water: Zero.

cards.name: Muck Hunter
cards.text: Rush\nBattlecry: Summon two 2/1_Mucklings for your opponent.
cards.flavor: You think your job mucks.

cards.name: Prince Liam
cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Transform all\n1-Cost cards in your deck\n_into Legendary minions.
cards.flavor: "I have a very particular set of skills. Skills that make me a nightmare for witches like you."

cards.name: Quartz Elemental
cards.text: Can't attack while damaged.
cards.flavor: These elementals, along with feldspar and mica, are often taken for granite.
